intro: Hieracium loennrothii, commonly known as the Loennroth's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium loennrothii is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
